Dua siswi dilarang kenakan hijab di sekolah, PBB serukan peningkatan toleransi bergama
07 Nov 2019, 14:25 by BBC



Seorang pejabat senior PBB di Malawi menyerukan toleransi beragama setelah dua siswi dilarang mengenakan hijab di lingkungan sekolah.
Pelarangan pemakaian hijab terjadi di satu sekolah di Balaka, kota yang terletak sekitar 206 kilometer di barat daya ibu kota Lilongwe.
Koordinator PBB untuk Malawi, Maria Jose Torres, mengatakan warga Malawi semestinya "menghormati keyakinan pemeluk agama dan selalu mengedepankan dialog secara damai dalam menyelesaikan persoalan".


Cina larang warga Xinjiang pelihara janggut panjang dan jilbab di ruang publik


Norwegia akan larang jilbab yang menutup wajah sepenuhnya di sekolah


Pengadilan Uni Eropa: Larangan berjilbab di tempat kerja tak diskriminatif


"Hak untuk berekspresi dan menjalankan agama adalah hak-hak dasar. Menghalangi pelaksanaan hak-hak tersebut - seperti melarang murid mengenakan pakaian sesuai keyakinan beragama mereka - adalah pelanggaran hak asasi manusia dan tidak sesusai dengan standar pendidikan internasional," kata Torres melalui pernyataan tertulis.
"Pelarangan [hijab] hanya akan membuat anak-anak perempuan enggan bersekolah, menghalangi mereka untuk belajar dan berpartisipasi secara aktif dalam kehidupan bermasyarakat, di saat Malawi berupaya menghentikan pernikahan anak dan mendorong anak-anak untuk mendapatkan pendidikan," katanya.
Insiden pelarangan hijab terjadi pada Senin (04/11) di Sekolah M'manga.



Pelarangan hijab memicu pertikaian antara warga Muslim dan Kristen yang menyebabkan setidaknya dua orang mengalami luka-luka serius, menurut surat kabar setempat, The Daily Times.
Disebutkan, beberapa toko, satu masjid, satu gereja, dan rumah pendeta rusak setelah pecah kerusuhan.


Austria mulai berlakukan larangan kerudung penutup wajah di tempat umum


Mengapa Prancis tolak jaringan toko menjual hijab untuk pelari perempuan?


Sekolah yang melarang hijab tersebut dikelola oleh Gereja Anglikan.
Sebelumnya, dalam kasus yang berbeda pada 2016, pengadilan di Kenya memutuskan bahwa sekolah-sekolah Kristen tak semestinya melarang pelajar Muslim memakai hijab di sekolah.



Hakim beralasan, lembaga pendidikan seharusnya mempromosikan keberagaman dan prinsip nondiskriminasi.
Sekitar 11% penduduk Kenya beragama Islam, sementara 83% memeluk Kristen.
Semua sekolah negeri di Kenya membolehkan siswa Muslim mengenakan hijab di sekolah.
Namun, keputusan pengadilan soal sekolah Kristen harus membolehkan siswa Muslim mengenakan hijab dibatalkan oleh Mahkamah Agung pada Januari 2019.
text:
Two female students are banned from wearing hijab at school, the UN calls for increased religious tolerance
Nov 7 2019, 14:25 by BBC



A senior UN official in Malawi called for religious tolerance after two students were banned from wearing the hijab in a school environment.
The ban on the wearing of the hijab occurred at a school in Balaka, a city located about 206 kilometers southwest of the capital city Lilongwe.
The UN coordinator for Malawi, Maria Jose Torres, said Malawians should "respect the beliefs of religious believers and always prioritize peaceful dialogue in solving problems".


China bans Xinjiang residents from maintaining long beards and headscarves in public spaces


Norway will ban headscarves that cover their faces completely at school


European Union Court: Prohibition of veiling in the workplace is not discriminatory


"The right to express and practice religion are basic rights. Preventing the exercise of these rights - such as prohibiting students from wearing clothing according to their religious beliefs - is a violation of human rights and not in accordance with international education standards," Torres said in a written statement.
"The [hijab] ban will only make girls reluctant to go to school, prevent them from learning and actively participate in community life, as Malawi seeks to stop child marriages and encourage children to get an education," he said.
The hijab ban incident occurred on Monday (04/11) at M'manga School.



The banning of the hijab triggered a dispute between Muslims and Christians that left at least two people seriously injured, according to the local newspaper, The Daily Times.
It said several shops, a mosque, a church and a priest's house were damaged after riots broke out.


Austria began to impose a ban on face veils in public places


Why did France reject the chain of stores selling hijab for female runners?


The school which bans hijab is managed by the Anglican Church.
Earlier, in a different case in 2016, a court in Kenya ruled that Christian schools should not forbid Muslim students from wearing the hijab in schools.



Judges reasoned, educational institutions should promote diversity and the principle of non-discrimination.
About 11% of Kenya's population is Muslim, while 83% are Christians.
All state schools in Kenya allow Muslim students to wear the hijab at school.
However, a court ruling over Christian schools must allow Muslim students to wear the hijab overturned by the Supreme Court in January 2019.
